item.title: Fixing C# type pattern-matching
item.description: Craving Kotlin's secure pattern matching on sealed classes for your C# code? Discover how the Visitor Pattern can satisfy your longing!

item.title: Checking MongoDB Operation Status: A Simple Guide
item.description: Learn how to easily check the status of your MongoDB operations with this step-by-step guide.

item.title: Unlocking the Power of Generics: Simulating Dictionary Behavior in C#
item.description: Do you want to improve performance of caching? Get rid of Dictionary and use just CLR for that!

item.title: Benefits of deconstructors for custom types
item.description: How and when to use deconstruction syntax-sugar for your custom types in C#

item.title: Testing Private Code in C#: Breaking Encapsulation with InternalsVisibleTo Attribute
item.description: Learn about the different options available for testing private logic in C# and how the InternalsVisibleTo attribute can help you access internal members without compromising the encapsulation of your code.

item.title: Using CallerMemberName for Improved Logging in C#
item.description: Learn how to use "magic" attributes in C#, such as CallerFilePath, CallerLineNumber, and CallerMemberName, to retrieve caller information and improve logging functionality.

item.title: Shift Your C# Enums
item.description: Discover the simple yet powerful technique of using bitwise shift operator in C# Enums, and how it can improve the readability and maintainability of your code.
